name: Fairfield Inn Santa Clarita Valencia

reviews.title: would stay there again
reviews.text: I have now stayed in 4 different hotels of approx the same cost while visiting my daughter in Santa Clarita. This is definitely the nicest for the money. The room was very recently redecorated; it looked like new carpet, new drapes, new bedspread, etc. The room was well cleaned every day & all the staff I met were very courteous. The free continental breakfast was pretty good. They even had little cups of waffle batter & a waffle iron to make your own waffles. I plan on staying here next time I'm in the area
I have stayed at this hotel with my wife and kids 4 times. We usually stay here on our way to Arizona. It's about the halfway point.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay.

reviews.text: First time at a Fairlfield Inn and we loved it! My husband and I were returning from LA and stopped for the night. Clean room, good breakfast in the AM, everything was just perfect. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Great clean hotel

reviews.text: Great customer service in reservations (booked a group of 10 rooms): excellent communication, rates, & follow up. Small hotel but it was all we needed. Pool was temporarily out of service but they offered us the use of the Residence Inn pool next door (same ownership); very nice. Linens are great, as their website states; but mattresses were boxy. Breakfast was perfect for our group; included some protein for our sports team, unlike most complimentary breakfasts. Very clean. Stayed 2 nights. Some freeway noise and construction trucks beeping; but all the hotels in this area are right by the freeway. A lot of restaurants & tons of shopping nearby. Busy town on a Saturday night: there was a 45-60 minute wait at most restaurants we tried, except at Spumoni (20 minutes). Food & service there was great! Would definitely stay at the Fairfield again.
reviews.title: Stay here for Sta Clarita, Magic Mtn, Castaic

reviews.text: We were driving from the San Francisco area to San Diego. When we hit a traffic jam in Santa Clarita, we decided to stop for the night. We chose the Fairfield Inn because we thought it would be the least expensive lodging in the immediate area. We were very pleased with the hotel. It seemed new and was very clean. Our room was quite large. The continental breakfast was ok but the waffle iron for the "make-it yourself" waffles was not heated up enough to function correctly even though the breakfast area had been open for more than 1/2 hour. If I ever stay in Santa Clarita again, I would stay here again. We had a great Italian dinner at the nearby Spumoni Restaurant!
reviews.title: A non smoking hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a Wednesday night prior to catching a flight to Boston the next morning for LAX. Asked for a wake-up call at 3:50, to which I got the response, "That's a bit early, but we'll try!". I then set the alarm in the room for 3:50 a.m. (the clock was set for a.m. instead of p.m.) so it never went off. We got a call from our son, who was already at the airport in Los Angeles waiting for us at 5:30 which woke us up. Needless to say, we didn't get the wake-up call and missed our flight. During the drive to the airport, I tried to call to let them know that they had neglected to call us, no one answered the phone at the hotel.
reviews.title: Don't expect a wake-up call!

reviews.text: Got back to town and called to complain to the manager, Barbara. She gave a hundred excuses and failed to offer any compensation (even the room rate) for their error.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, a bit pricey.

aka: Fairfield Inn Santa Clarita Valencia Hotel
